div.h4: Connect Odoo with Your Online Store in a Few Simple Steps
div.p: This wizard guides you through setting up your connection to your e-commerce platform. Enter your store details and configure your default settings to get started.

group.name: fulfillment_sync_settings
group.div: This mapping is used for partial fulfillment of orders in Shopify. To change these mappings, go to the Inventory tab and edit the Inventory Location Mapping table there.

group.name: payment_sync_settings
group.div: If an order includes refunds, payments won’t be auto-applied. This allows users to follow their Odoo workflow, as handling refunds may require different approaches. Manual actions will be needed to validate invoices and register payments in Odoo.

group.name: other
group.div: Fiscal positions adjust taxes set on products. Please note that in some cases, the tax on individual order lines may differ from the product's default tax. In such cases, fiscal positions may not apply, or the line's tax may be replaced by the product's default tax in Odoo. Before enabling this option, ensure this approach meets your requirements.

group.name: external_order_field_mappings
group.string: Order and Delivery Attribute Import Mapping
group.div: Map JSON attributes from your e-commerce store to Odoo Sales Orders and Delivery Orders (Transfers) during import. You can also apply an optional Python transformation for complex data. Leave fields blank if you only need to store information on one model. This mapping does not affect data exported from Odoo back to the store.

group.name: customer_sync_settings
group.div: When enabled, the connector will use the company as the contact instead of creating individual contact records when company information is available. This is particularly useful for B2B scenarios where you want to maintain a cleaner contact structure by avoiding duplicate individual contacts for the same company.

group.name: ecommerce_fields_mappings
group.div: You have selected the VAT field for Company Registration Number synchronization. If you have the module "VAT Number Validation" installed, then Odoo will accept ONLY valid EU VAT numbers. If they are not valid - we will create Sales Order, but we will NOT add VAT to the Customer. Instead, we will add a warning to the sales order message thread informing about the wrong VAT number.

div.span: When this pricelist is selected, the connector will use prices from it during product export, if a pricelist item exists for the product. Otherwise, the product's default price will be used. Important: Setting a pricelist here prevents product prices from being updated during import. This avoids potential issues where the exported price (from the pricelist) and the actual product price in Odoo differ.

If a product is included in this pricelist, its sale price will be exported to the e-commerce system. If the product is not in the pricelist, an empty value will be sent to clear any existing sale price in the store. Important: Sale prices are never imported from the e-commerce system, even if the product is in this pricelist. This field is for export only.

page.name: webhooks_defaults
page.div: Webhooks enable instant communication between your e-commerce platform and Odoo. Instead of waiting for the next scheduled sync, your store can push events (like new or updated orders) directly to Odoo in real time. This is ideal for businesses that require immediate updates, faster fulfillment, and more accurate product updates sychronization and sales tracking across platforms.

group.p: This section displays a list of all webhooks currently established between Odoo and the e-commerce platform. These webhooks facilitate real-time data exchange for events in the e-commerce system.
group.div:
Webhooks Status Explanation Green – The webhook configuration is valid, successfully created in the e-commerce system, and functioning correctly.
Yellow – A mismatch was detected between Odoo’s web.base.url and the webhook’s callback URL. This requires an update to ensure the webhook remains functional.
Red – The webhook is inactive or otherwise not functioning. Further attention is needed to restore proper operation.

div.p: Use the buttons below to manage the webhooks that enable real-time data exchange between Odoo and the e-commerce system. 'Create Webhooks' will establish new connections for immediate updates on specified events, while 'Drop Webhooks' will remove these connections and stop the real-time updates.

Activate this feature to record detailed logs of the webhooks operations. Logging can provide valuable insights and facilitate troubleshooting should any issues arise. It is particularly useful for identifying the sequence of events leading to unexpected outcomes.

page.name: external_integration
page.div: Our connector enables additional API routes to enhance the integration between Odoo and your e-commerce platform. These APIs allow your store to request or receive structured business data—such as invoices — directly from your Odoo.

div.p: Allow your e-commerce store to download Odoo-generated invoices automatically using our dedicated extensions for WooCommerce and PrestaShop. This API endpoint returns a PDF invoice based on the external order ID, letting customers retrieve official documents post-purchase.
How It Works

ol.li: The customer initiates an invoice download request (via your store’s UI).
The store plugin sends a request to your Odoo backend via the Invoices API.
Odoo locates the related order, generates a PDF invoice using your configured report template, and returns the file.

div.p: Configure and manage automated jobs that synchronize data between Odoo and your e-commerce platform. Jobs are tasks that run in the background, ensuring that critical updates, like product information and order statuses, are regularly exported to keep both systems in sync. Enable the jobs relevant to your workflow to maintain real-time accuracy and efficiency.

group.name: order_processing_jobs
group.div: Ensure you have correctly configured the Inventory Location Mapping table on the Inventory tab before enabling this option. Incorrect mappings may lead to fulfillment errors in Shopify.

div.p: Begin by synchronizing the core components of your e-commerce ecosystem. This step involves the automatic download and mapping of essential data entities from your e-commerce system into Odoo.
Once initiated, the connector will:

ul.li: Retrieve master data such as Shipping Methods, Taxes, Payment Methods, and more.
Populate corresponding External Records in Odoo.
Automatically map entities with matching attributes in Odoo, for seamless integration.

div.p: In case certain entities do not find an exact match in Odoo, a manual mapping will be required. For these instances, you'll need to visit the 'Mappings' menu corresponding to the entity (e.g., 'Mappings → Taxes', 'Mappings → Shipping Methods', etc.). Here you can manually establish connections by clicking "Import [entity]".
div.div: Remember This step doesn't complete the integration but prepares the groundwork for a smooth data flow between systems. After synchronization, it's crucial to review and map any unmatched entities to ensure comprehensive integration.

div.p: This stage focuses on aligning your e-commerce platform's product catalog with Odoo's product database. When you click the 'Link Products' button, the following occurs:

ul.li: The system performs a validation check on products listed in the external system. If discrepancies or errors are detected, you'll be notified via a popup listing the issues that need your attention.
Records for external products and their variants are created within the 'External → Products' and "External → Product Variants" menus.
The connector attempts to automatically link external products to Odoo products by comparing internal references or barcodes.

div.div: Important "Link Products" button does not generate new product entries in Odoo. It's designed to establish links for products that already exist in both systems. If a product in your e-commerce system doesn't have a corresponding match in Odoo, it won't be created automatically. For these products, you'll need to navigate to 'Mappings → Products' and use the "Import Product" button to create and link them manually in Odoo.

div.p: This step initiates stock level synchronization between your e-commerce platform and Odoo. By clicking on "Import Stock Levels," you will access a wizard that helps you map external warehouse locations to their corresponding locations in Odoo. Once set up, the system will align stock quantities to reflect your current inventory.
div.div: Attention Required Before initiating the stock level synchronization, please carefully read and understand all notes provided in the wizard. This step involves significant changes to your inventoryrecords and requires a clear understanding of the implications. Proceed with caution and ensure all settings accurately reflect your inventory management requirements.

div.p: Initiate customer integration by clicking "Import Customers". This process will start a dedicated wizard that allows you to select a starting date, ensuring that you import customer data from your e-commerce platform to Odoo from the specified date onward.
What to expect:

ul.li: The wizard creates a job for each customer in the external system that has been updated after the specified date.
It will automatically try to match customers from the e-commerce platform to existing customers in Odoo based on name and address, updating the records accordingly.
If there are customers in your external system that cannot be matched to existing records in Odoo, new customer entries will be created within your Odoo database.

If the "Enable Manual Customer Mapping" setting is enabled on the integration, the system will not attempt to auto-match customers based on name and address. Instead, a new open mapping will be created for each customer, allowing you to manually map them to existing Odoo customers or create new ones as needed.

div.p: Use this feature to integrate 'Product Special Prices' from your e-commerce platform into Odoo. By clicking this button, you'll launch a wizard that guides you through linking external pricelists with their corresponding Odoo pricelists. After establishing the links, you can proceed to synchronize the pricelists. This process is a one-way synchronization that pulls special pricing data from your e-commerce system to update the pricelists in Odoo, ensuring your Odoo system reflects the most current pricing strategies.

This step is specifically added for users of the PrestaShop connector. It ensures that your 'Related Products' from PrestaShop are synchronized with Odoo's 'Optional Products'. Once you have completed the product linking and mapping process in Step 2, you can use this function to synchronize the optional products in Odoo with the related products defined in your PrestaShop system. It scans through the related products information in PrestaShop and updates the 'Optional Products' field in Odoo accordingly, maintaining consistency across both platforms.

page.div: Developer Debug Settings The configuration options within this tab are strictly for debugging purposes and require an advanced understanding of the system's internals. Adjusting these settings can lead to significant alterations in how the integration operates. Proceed with caution and only if you have a comprehensive grasp of the processes involved. If you are not a technical user or are unsure about the implications of these changes, please seek assistance from a qualified developer.

div.p: Clicking this button will clear the adapter's cache, ensuring that any changes made to the integration parameters take effect immediately. Utilize this function if updates or alterations have been made to the settings and you need to refresh the system's memory to apply these new configurations without delay.
By checking this checkbox you agree that you understand the risks and take responsibility for further using this property during product synchronization in the E-Commerce System.
